member.name: T:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WGBEvent
member.summary: A serializable class for event binding.
member.remarks: Events can be bound (public MonoBehaviour methods), use SendMessage (GameObject and method name), or use delegates. This class supports multicast events, and is safe (it will not throw exceptions for missing delegates or methods).

member.name: T:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage
member.summary: Represents a language for a word game.
member.remarks: Most aspects of a language are edited through the Language Editor.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.decompressOnLoad
member.summary: Should a language automatically be decompressed on load?
member.remarks: Note that this only applies to languages called with Language.current. Other languages will only decompress if set to the current language.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.defaultLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the default language, by name. This value is saved to PlayerPrefs.
member.remarks: This is initially set to English.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.current
member.summary: Gets or sets the current language.
member.remarks: If the current language is not set, this property returns the default language (if available), or the first loaded language. If no languages are loaded, this property attempts to load all langauges with Language.LoadLanguages(). Due to how Unity compares objects, this property is not thread-safe. To get around this, cache the language first.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.languageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the language name.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.identifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the language's identifier (usually the file name).

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.culture
member.summary: The language's culture.

member.summary: Gets a random word from the language.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.GetRandomWord(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a random word from the language, ensuring that it is under the maximum amount of letters.
member.remarks: This is a recursive random search and hard-capped at 10,000 iterations (it returns null on failure). It is recommended to prune unused words from the language to help ensure this search does not fail.
member.param: The maximum amount of letters permitted for a random word.
member.returns: A random word from the language, up to maxLetters.

member.summary: Sets the psuedo-random number generator for the language. The pRNG's seed is time-based by default.
member.param: The random seed to assign to the language.
member.remarks: The pRNG is used for picking random letters, random words, and lossy prefix search.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage.GetRandomNumberGenerator
member.summary: Gets the psuedo-random number generator for the language.

member.returns: The language's random number generator.

member.name: T:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet
member.summary: A specialized data structure for storing letters and words.
member.remarks: The WordSet is a highly optimized structure for fast word searches. It is loaded in a compressed form, and must be decompressed before lookup operations will work.

member.summary: The maximum length of a prefix in the word set's internal representation.
member.remarks: This value is implementation-specific and cannot be changed.

member.summary: Gets the amount of words in the word set.

member.summary: Whether or not the word set is expanded in memory.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet.Optimize
member.summary: Optimizes a word set for fast searches. This may take a while and should be done offline - not at runtime.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet.Decompress
member.summary: Expands the set from compressed form.
member.remarks: If Language.decompressOnLoad is disabled, this must be called explicitly.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet.Decompress(System.Action{System.Single},System.Int32)
member.summary: Expands the set from compressed form. Yields when progress is updated and can be used in a coroutine.
member.param: The method to call each time the task's progress is updated. This method must take a float as the only argument.
The maximum amount of iterations to process per frame. Defaults to 100.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object. This method can be used as a coroutine.
member.remarks: If Language.decompressOnLoad is disabled, this must be called explicitly.

member.remarks: If Language.decompressOnLoad is disabled, this must be called explicitly.

member.summary: Expands the set from compressed form asynchronously.

The method to call each time the task's progress is updated. This method must take a float as the only argument.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet.FindWord(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds the word in the set.
member.returns: A WordResult representing the results of the lookup operation.
member.param: The string input for the lookup operation.
If true, performs a check on the string, in order. If false, performs a permutation check on every combination of the string.
member.remarks: Search operations in the word set use the underlying dictionary strings, unlike the WordChecker class, which uses letter tiles.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordSet.FindWord(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the word in the set.
member.returns: A WordResult representing the results of the lookup operation.
member.param: The string input for the lookup operation.
If true, performs a check on the string, in order. If false, performs a permutation check on every combination of the string.
The maximum length of a word input. If the input is longer than this value, it will be truncated.
The maximum amount of iterations for any permutation checks.
member.remarks: Search operations in the word set use the underlying dictionary strings, unlike the WordChecker class, which uses letter tiles.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordChecker.CheckWord(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.ObjectModel.ILetterTile},System.Boolean,Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.WordGameLanguage,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the input word against a language dictionary.
member.returns: A WordGameResult representing the results of the lookup operation.
member.param: The letter tile input for the lookup operation.
If true, performs a check on the tiles, in order. If false, performs a permutation check on every combination of the letter tiles. Defaults to true.
The language to check the word against. Defaults to the current language.
The maximum word length for the lookup operation. Defaults to WordChecker.maxWordLength.
The maximum amount of iterations for any permutation checks. Defaults to WordChecker.maxWordLength.

member.summary: Checks the input word against the dictionary, asynchronously on another thread.
member.returns: An Task representing the asynchronous task.
member.param: The letter tile input for the lookup operation.
The method to call upon completion. This method must take a WordGameResult as the only argument.
If true, performs a check on the tiles, in order. If false, performs a permutation check on every combination of the letter tiles.
The language to check the word against.
The maximum word length for the lookup operation. Overrides WordChecker.maxWordLength.
The maximum amount of iterations for any permutation checks. Overrides WordChecker.maxWordLength.
If true, this method will always execute on another thread.
member.remarks: If less than 4 tiles are specified and forceAsync = false, this method is run on the same thread that it is called and returns an empty task.

member.name: T:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent
member.summary: Represents a word game AI agent. The agent is multithreaded and supports automatic selection/submission.
member.remarks: This component requires a WordGamePlayer to be present. Letter tile implementations that use ISelectableLetterTile will obey selection rules.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.ignorePlayerInputState
member.summary: If true, ignore the player's inputEnabled property.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.threshold
member.summary: Controls how many candidate words are kept when sorted by score.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.bias
member.summary: A value between 0 and 1 that controls how aggressive or "intelligent" the agent is at getting words.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will pick a random word from the top candidates. A value of 1 will always find the highest-scoring word from the top candidates.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.minWordLength
member.summary: The minimum amount of letters for a candidate word.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.maxWordLength
member.summary: The maximum amount of letters for a candidate word.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.maxPrefixIterations
member.summary: For long words (over a word set's max prefix length), a prefix check is performed to speed up the algorithm. This value controls the maximum number of iterations to perform with the prefix check.
member.remarks: Higher iteration counts take more processing and memory power, but produce more accurate results.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.maxWords
member.summary: The maximum amount of words to find before selecting a candidate.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.maxTime
member.summary: The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to look for words before selecting a candidate or retrying/giving up.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.retryCount
member.summary: The maximum amount of times to retry a search, if a root has not yet been searched.
member.remarks: Retries will only happen if a root hasn't been searched (All words starting with a specific tile).

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.processWildcards
member.summary: If true, blank tiles will be processed as wildcard tiles.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.customWildcardScoring
member.summary: If true, selecting wildcard tiles will be calculated using a custom point value.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.customWildcardScore
member.summary: If customWildcardScoring = true, the custom point value to assign to wildcard tiles.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.customWildcardScores
member.summary: A dictionary that can be modified to have more fine grained control over the scoring for wildcard tiles.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.autoSelectWord
member.summary: If enabled, automatically select the best found word.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.autoSelectTime
member.summary: If autoSelectWord is enabled, the amount of time to wait between selecting tiles.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.autoSubmitWord
member.summary: If enabled, automatically submit the best found word. This has no effect if autoSelectWord is disabled.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilder.Gameplay.WordGameAgent.autoSubmitTime
member.summary: If autoSubmitWord is enabled, the amount of time to wait before submitting tiles. This has no effect if autoSelectWord is disabled.

member.summary: This event fires whenever the agent has found a set of words.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessTasks
member.summary: Processes all remaining tasks. Call this periodically to allow the Dispatcher to handle dispatched tasks. Only call this inside the thread you want the tasks to process to be processed.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessTasks(System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Processes all remaining tasks and returns true when something has been processed and false otherwise. This method will block until th exitHandle has been set or tasks should be processed. Only call this inside the thread you want the tasks to process to be processed.
member.param: The handle to indicate an early abort of the wait process.
member.returns: False when the exitHandle has been set, true otherwise.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessNextTask
member.summary: Processed the next available task. Only call this inside the thread you want the tasks to process to be processed.
member.returns: True when a task to process has been processed, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessNextTask(System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Processes the next available tasks and returns true when it has been processed and false otherwise. This method will block until th exitHandle has been set or a task should be processed. Only call this inside the thread you want the tasks to process to be processed.
member.param: The handle to indicate an early abort of the wait process.
member.returns: False when the exitHandle has been set, true otherwise.

member.summary: Disposes all dispatcher resources and remaining tasks.

member.summary: Bass class for a task.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.shouldAbort
member.summary: Returns true if the task should abort. If a Task should abort and has not yet been started it will never start but indicate an end and failed state.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.hasEnded
member.summary: Returns true when processing of this task has been ended or has been skipped due early abortion.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.isSucceeded
member.summary: Returns true when the task has successfully been processed. Tasks which throw exceptions will not be set to a failed state, also any exceptions will not be catched, the user needs to add checks for these kind of situation.

member.name: P:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.isFailed
member.summary: Returns true if the task should abort and has been ended. This value will not been set to true in case of an exception while processing this task. The user needs to add checks for these kind of situation.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.Abort
member.summary: Notifies the task to abort and sets the task state to failed. The task needs to check ShouldAbort if the task should abort.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.AbortWait
member.summary: Notifies the task to abort and sets the task state to failed. The task needs to check ShouldAbort if the task should abort. This method will wait until the task has been aborted/ended.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.AbortWaitForSeconds(System.Single)
member.summary: Notifies the task to abort and sets the task state to failed. The task needs to check ShouldAbort if the task should abort. This method will wait until the task has been aborted/ended or the given timeout has been reached.
member.param: Time in seconds this method will max wait.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.Wait
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the task has been ended.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.WaitForSeconds(System.Single)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the task has been ended or the given timeout value has been reached.
member.param: Time in seconds this method will max wait.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.Wait``1
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the task has been ended and returns the return value of the task as the given type. Use this method only for Tasks with return values (functions)!
member.returns: The return value of the task as the given type.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.WaitForSeconds``1(System.Single)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the task has been ended and returns the return value of the task as the given type. Use this method only for Tasks with return values (functions)!
member.param: Time in seconds this method will max wait.
member.returns: The return value of the task as the given type.

member.name: M:Thinksquirrel.WordGameBuilderInternal.Threading.TaskBase.WaitForSeconds``1(System.Single,``0)

member.param: Time in seconds this method will max wait.
